SEARCH
Package com.ubicua.didas.rest

Class CustomAdminClientRoleResource

java.lang.Object
com.ubicua.didas.rest.CustomAdminClientRoleResource
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.keycloak.provider.Provider, org.keycloak.services.resources.admin.ext.AdminRealmResourceProvider
@Path("/admin") public class CustomAdminClientRoleResource extends Object implements org.keycloak.services.resources.admin.ext.AdminRealmResourceProvider
REST resource provider for managing client roles and user profiles.

Exposes endpoints for updating client roles, DID service documents, user profile configurations, and user entities via the Admin API.

Author:
Ivan Kuchumov

  • Constructor Details

    • CustomAdminClientRoleResource

  • Method Details

    • updateClientRole

      @Path("/realms/{realm}/clients/{client_id}/roles/{role-name}") @PUT @Consumes("application/json") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response updateClientRole(@PathParam("realm") String realmName, @PathParam("client_id") String clientId, @PathParam("role-name") String roleName, org.keycloak.representations.idm.RoleRepresentation rep) throws org.keycloak.common.VerificationException
      Handles HTTP PUT to update a client role within a realm.

      1. Resolves and sets the realm context.
      2. Extracts and verifies the Bearer token from the Authorization header.
      3. Constructs an AdminAuth and AdminPermissionEvaluator to enforce manage permissions.
      4. Locates the ClientModel and its RoleModel to update; returns 404 if not found.
      5. Delegates detailed updates to updateRole(RoleRepresentation, RoleModel, RealmModel, KeycloakSession, String).
      6. Publishes AdminEvent (client or realm role) and returns 204 No Content.
      Parameters:
      realmName - the target realm name
      clientId - the client ID owning the role
      roleName - the name of the role to update
      rep - the incoming RoleRepresentation with updated values
      Returns:
      HTTP 204 on success; appropriate error on failure
      Throws:
      org.keycloak.common.VerificationException - if token verification fails

    • updateRole

      protected void updateRole(org.keycloak.representations.idm.RoleRepresentation rep, org.keycloak.models.RoleModel role, org.keycloak.models.RealmModel realm, org.keycloak.models.KeycloakSession session, String clientId)
      Applies detailed updates to a RoleModel based on the provided representation.

      1. Validates attribute constraints via validateRoleAttributes(RoleRepresentation, RealmModel, String).
      2. Renames the role if rep.getName() differs from role.getName(), emitting a RoleNameChangeEvent.
      3. Updates the description and synchronizes attribute map:
        • Adds or updates values from rep.getAttributes().
        • Removes any attributes missing in rep.
      Parameters:
      rep - the RoleRepresentation with new values
      role - the persistent RoleModel to modify
      realm - the realm context
      session - the current Keycloak session
      clientId - the client ID for scoping validation

    • validateRoleAttributes

      private void validateRoleAttributes(@NotNull org.keycloak.representations.idm.RoleRepresentation rep, org.keycloak.models.RealmModel realm, String clientId)
      Validates that a role's representation meets the discovery component constraints.

      Checks include:

      • Presence and syntax of 'id', 'context', and 'service' attributes.
      • Ensures no extra attributes beyond the allowed set.
      • Throws ErrorResponseException on any violation, surfaced as HTTP 400.
      Parameters:
      rep - the RoleRepresentation to validate
      realm - the realm in which the role resides
      clientId - the client ID owning the role
      Throws:
      org.keycloak.services.ErrorResponseException - if any validation rule is violated

    • isJsonValid

      public boolean isJsonValid(String json)

    • update

      @Path("/realms/{realm}/users/profile") @PUT @Consumes("application/json") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response update(org.keycloak.representations.userprofile.config.UPConfig config) throws org.keycloak.common.VerificationException
      Handles HTTP PUT to update the realm's user profile configuration.

      1. Resolves realm and authenticates admin permissions.
      2. Delegates to the UserProfileProvider to set the new UPConfig.
      3. Emits an AdminEvent and returns the updated configuration.
      Parameters:
      config - the new UPConfig
      Returns:
      the applied UPConfig on success
      Throws:
      org.keycloak.common.VerificationException - if token verification fails

    • updateUser

      @Path("/realms/{realm}/users/{userId}") @PUT @Consumes("application/json") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response updateUser(@PathParam("realm") String realmName, @PathParam("userId") String userId, org.keycloak.representations.idm.UserRepresentation rep) throws org.keycloak.common.VerificationException
      Handles HTTP PUT to update a user entity within a realm.

      1. Loads the target user by ID; returns 404 if not found.
      2. Processes attributes for vehicle assignment.
      3. Authenticates via Bearer token and enforces manage user permissions.
      4. Constructs a UserProfile for validation.
      5. Delegates to validateUserProfile(org.keycloak.userprofile.UserProfile, KeycloakSession, AdminAuth)
      6. Applies representation changes via updateUserFromRep(org.keycloak.userprofile.UserProfile, UserModel, UserRepresentation, KeycloakSession, boolean)
      7. Commits changes or returns validation errors.
      Parameters:
      realmName - target realm name
      userId - ID of the user to update
      rep - incoming UserRepresentation with updated fields
      Returns:
      HTTP 204 on success or error response on failure
      Throws:
      org.keycloak.common.VerificationException - if token verification fails

    • updateUserFromRep

      private void updateUserFromRep(org.keycloak.userprofile.UserProfile profile, org.keycloak.models.UserModel user, org.keycloak.representations.idm.UserRepresentation rep, org.keycloak.models.KeycloakSession session, boolean isUpdateExistingUser)
      Applies fields from a UserRepresentation onto an existing UserModel.

      Handles the following updates:

      • enabled and emailVerified flags, clearing login failures if re-enabled.
      • federationLink, required actions, and credentials.
      • Attributes such as vehicle assignments, respecting multivalued flags.
      Parameters:
      profile - the validated UserProfile containing updated values
      user - the persistent UserModel to modify
      rep - the original UserRepresentation
      session - the current Keycloak session
      isUpdateExistingUser - true if updating an existing user

    • validateUserProfile

      private jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response validateUserProfile(org.keycloak.userprofile.UserProfile profile, org.keycloak.models.KeycloakSession session, org.keycloak.services.resources.admin.AdminAuth adminAuth)
      Validates a UserProfile instance, converting validation failures into a list of ErrorRepresentation and returning a 400 response.
      Parameters:
      profile - the UserProfile to validate
      session - the current Keycloak session
      adminAuth - AdminAuth context for permission checks (optional)
      Returns:
      Response with 400 and error list if validation fails; null if valid
